intro: Anemone caffra, commonly known as the African anemone, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, white or pink flowers with five to seven petals, often arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
